alert.note: Alert for Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 3:19AM CDT until June 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Hays and Travis. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 319 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Austin, Kyle, Buda, Tanglewood Forest, Mustang Ridge, Niederwald, Bear Creek, Onion Creek, Shady Hollow, Manchaca, Mountain City, San Leanna, Hays, Creedmoor and Maha. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
